aggregation-types.name: sum
aggregation-types.title: Sum
aggregation-types.description: Calculates the sum of all values in a column

aggregation-types.name: avg
aggregation-types.title: Average
aggregation-types.description: Calculates the average (mean) of all values in a column

aggregation-types.name: min
aggregation-types.title: Minimum
aggregation-types.description: Returns the minimum value from a column

aggregation-types.name: max
aggregation-types.title: Maximum
aggregation-types.description: Returns the maximum value from a column

aggregation-types.name: first
aggregation-types.title: First
aggregation-types.description: Returns the first value from a column

aggregation-types.name: last
aggregation-types.title: Last
aggregation-types.description: Returns the last value from a column

aggregation-types.name: count
aggregation-types.title: Count
aggregation-types.description: Counts the number of rows in a column

aggregation-types.name: countdistinct
aggregation-types.title: Count Distinct
aggregation-types.description: Counts the number of unique values in a column

aggregation-types.name: stdev
aggregation-types.title: Standard Deviation
aggregation-types.description: Calculates the standard deviation of values in a column

oox-analyzer.description:
During routine release testing of Drug Substance lot DS-25-0411, the SE-HPLC chromatogram showed an unexpected increase in high-molecular-weight (HMW) species at 4.1%, compared to the historical range of 1.2%–2.0%. The result remained within specification (<5.0%) but fell outside the established expectation window defined by method lifecycle data.

Because this deviation did not exceed specification but was uncharacteristic for this process stage, it was logged as an OOE event.
oox-analyzer.specifications:
Measured HMW %: 4.1%

Historical mean: 1.6%

Historical ±3SD range: 0.9% – 2.3%

Release specification limit: <5.0%

Repeat injection: 4.0% (consistent with initial result)

Chromatogram shape: Slightly broadened HMW peak; no abnormal retention shifts
oox-analyzer.rootCauseAnalysis:
The result was:

Not OOS → within specification

Not OOT → method control samples were normal

OOE → unexpected relative to historical product behavior

Triggers for OOE classification:

Deviation >3SD from established product trend

No corresponding upstream deviation identified at the time

Control standard showed expected purity profile
oox-analyzer.preventiveActions:
4.1 Instrument & System Suitability Check

System suitability parameters (resolution, tailing, theoretical plates) met acceptance criteria.

Column back-pressure normal.

No abnormal baseline drifts.
→ Instrument performance ruled out.

4.2 Reagent / Consumable Verification

Mobile-phase lot consistent with prior batches; no documented anomalies.

Column used had remaining validated lifetime and showed no prior performance drift.

Reference standard chromatogram matched historical pattern.
→ Reagents and consumables unlikely contributors.

4.3 Sample Handling Review

Sample logbook shows no delayed preparation or storage deviation.

Labeling and chain-of-custody verified.

Duplicate aliquot produced nearly identical profile (HMW 4.0%).
→ Sample handling error not supported.

4.4 Process and Manufacturing Data Review

Correlation explored with:

Temperature trends during final purification

Shear exposure during filtration

Hold times prior to freezing

Glycosylation consistency and charge variant profiles

Appendix 1: Reporting categories and suggested review timelines
Appendix 2: Changes to the drug substance

The proposed facility is an approved drug substance facility for biotherapeutics (for the same company/marketing authorization holder).
Any changes to the manufacturing process and/or controls are considered either moderate or minor (for example, duplication of product line).
The new facility/suite is under the same quality assurance/quality control oversight.
The proposed change does not involve additional containment requirements.
There should remain at least one site/manufacturer, as previously authorized, performing the same function as the one(s) to be deleted.
The deletion should not be due to critical deficiencies in manufacturing (for example, recurrent out-of-specification events, environmental monitoring failures, etc.).

dynamic-queries.description: Five-level nested query showing the full hierarchy: inquiries contain tenders, which contain tender items and invitations. Tender items contain quotations, which contain quotation items.

dynamic-queries.description: Get all user roles with their members (users), access policies, and app permissions. Shows the complete hierarchy: User_roles → users (HAS_MEMBER), User_roles → App_access_policies (HAS_ACCESS_POLICY), App_access_policies → App_permissions (HAS_APP_PERMISSION)

dynamic-queries.name: Users with User Roles, Access Policies, and Permissions
dynamic-queries.description: Get all user with their roles , access policies, and app permissions. Shows the complete hierarchy:  users → User_roles (HAS_MEMBER), User_roles → App_access_policies (HAS_ACCESS_POLICY), App_access_policies → App_permissions (HAS_APP_PERMISSION)

deviation-management.deviationTitle: Non-contemporaneous recording of environmental monitoring results
deviation-management.deviationDescription: During routine QA review of environmental monitoring (EM) records for Grade B cleanroom (Room B-204), it was observed that EM results for settle plates and active air sampling dated 2025-06-15 were recorded in the official logbook on 2025-06-17. The entries were not recorded at the time the activity was performed.
deviation-management.expectedCondition: According to SOP QC-EM-012, all environmental monitoring results must be recorded contemporaneously at the time of sampling or immediately after completion of the activity, with date and time documented.
deviation-management.actualConditionObserved: EM results were transcribed from analyst personal notes into the official logbook two days after sampling. No contemporaneous time stamps or raw notes were attached to the record.
deviation-management.locationArea: Manufacturing Building 2 – Grade B Cleanroom B-204

affectedProductMaterial.label: Sterile injectable Product X (API Lot AX-442)

deviation-management.qaInitialDecision: Full deviation investigation required; batch disposition decision deferred until completion.

identifiedRootCauses.label: Inadequate enforcement of contemporaneous documentation requirements and reliance on informal note-taking during EM activities.

contributingFactors.label: Insufficient training emphasis on ALCOA+ principles
Lack of real-time documentation tools in cleanroom
Inadequate QA oversight of EM logbooks

scientificTechnicalRationale.label: Environmental monitoring data is a critical element of sterility assurance. Delayed transcription compromises data reliability and prevents confirmation that conditions were acceptable at the time of manufacture.

capa.actionTitle: QA review of all EM records for the affected batch
Independent verification of raw EM data where available
Batch disposition decision documented with risk assessment
Revision of SOP QC-EM-012 to explicitly prohibit post-shift transcription
Introduction of controlled EM data capture sheets used inside cleanroom
Mandatory ALCOA+ refresher training for QC and Manufacturing personnel
Increased QA presence during EM activities for 3 months

effectivenessCriteria.label: 100% of EM records completed contemporaneously with no retrospective entries over a 3-month monitoring period.

deviation-management.qaFinalReview: Investigation, CAPA, and effectiveness verification reviewed and found adequate. Data integrity risk addressed systemically. Approved – Head of Quality Assurance
deviation-management.justificationForClosure: Root cause adequately identified, CAPA implemented and verified effective, and no recurrence observed during monitoring period.

immediateActionTaken.label: Batch BX-250615-01 was placed on QA hold pending investigation outcome.

lean-management.briefWasteDescription: بهینه‌سازی امنیت و زیرساخت در فرآیندهای فناوری اطلاعات به منظور کاهش آسیب‌پذیری‌ها و اتلاف‌های ناشی از خرابی سیستم.
lean-management.location: مرکز داده و واحد زیرساخت IT
lean-management.wasteAssessmentJustification: زمان‌های طولانی انتظار (Waiting) برای پاسخگویی سرور و پردازش‌های اضافی (Extra Processing) در لایه‌های امنیتی غیربهینه شناسایی شده است.
lean-management.impactAnalysisJustification: اختلال در زیرساخت مستقیماً بر روی زمان تحویل سرویس و امنیت داده‌های حساس سازمان تأثیر منفی می‌گذارد.
lean-management.improvementIdea: پیاده‌سازی اتوماسیون امنیتی و به‌روزرسانی سخت‌افزارهای شبکه به منظور کاهش تأخیر و افزایش پایداری سیستم.
lean-management.overallAssessmentDescription: با اجرای این پروژه، پایداری زیرساخت بهبود یافته و ریسک‌های امنیتی به حداقل رسیده است.

project-proposal.projectTitle: راه اندازی دیتاسنتر موازی در دفتر تهران
project-proposal.projectReason: جهت کاهش ریسک های احتمالی در زمان جنگ و تضمین تداوم کسب و کار (Business Continuity) از طریق ایجاد زیرساخت موازی در دفتر تهران.

notes.title: تست متن فارسی
notes.noteContent:
i want to have a page /notes which is a comprehensive page for the user to keep his notes and checklists


first create notes schema (title, color,  noteContent, checklist (listitem),category (text), isBookmarked)

so the routes uses /api/data/notes

but in this page it would be custom form not the default form (show as modern note like google keep)

the notes would be shown like modern sticky notes beautiful
they can shown as accordion thatn collapsed and just show title, also show note as sticky and if longer, show more  and open dialog to show sticky

also i want to group notes by category and show pinned items on top

also search ability and filter category 

for the bookmark ability, create the feature allowDataBookmark in builder schema in schemas like allow data force and show as a modern icon favorite icon in system section @src/gradian-ui/form-builder/configs/system-section-fields.ts

change-management-records.changeTitle: Replacement of Failed Primary Temperature Control Module & Integration of New Redundant Monitoring Logic in MAb Production Bioreactors (BR-12 & BR-14)
change-management-records.changeDescription: During routine monitoring of upstream production, repeated deviations were observed in temperature feedback from BR-12 and BR-14. Investigation confirmed that the primary temperature control module in both reactors showed progressive signal drift and intermittent communication loss. Temperature is a critical process parameter (CPP) for mAb cell-culture viability and product quality. Historical data review showed mild drift beginning ~3 months prior but remaining within limits until failure escalation. Root cause suspected to be internal board degradation compounded by thermal cycling stress; supplier analysis pending.
change-management-records.proposedSolution: Engineering Removal & Installation: Replace faulty modules with validated, supplier-qualified units. Automation Update: Add dual-sensor plausibility logic (automatic flag if discrepancy exceeds limit, auto-switch to secondary sensor). GMP Documentation: Update equipment qualification package (IQ/OQ), revise equipment maintenance SOP. Requalification: Controlled functional tests and system-level calibration checks. Training: Brief staff on revised alarm behavior.
change-management-records.changeClassificationJustification: Classified as High Criticality due to the involvement of a Critical Process Parameter (CPP) affecting cell-culture viability and potential product quality, requiring hardware replacement and automation logic changes.
change-management-records.qaFinalReview: The temperature control module failure created a risk to process stability. Hardware replacement plus integration of enhanced redundancy logic reduced this risk and improved early-warning capability. All engineering, automation, and QA assessments concluded that bioreactors BR-12 and BR-14 are fit for continued GMP use. Redundant control logic demonstrated correct failover response during testing.
change-management-records.justificationForClosure: All post-change verification data met predefined acceptance criteria. No recurrence of drift or signal interruptions observed after 30-day monitoring period. Change implemented successfully without unplanned downtime. Final QA disposition: Change Closed – High Criticality, Fully Mitigated.

change-management-records.changeTitle: اصلاح و یکپارچه‌سازی افزونگی برای کنترل دمای بیوراکتورهای BR-12 و BR-14
change-management-records.changeDescription: شکست ماژول‌های اصلی کنترل دما در بیوراکتورهای BR-12 و BR-14 نشان‌دهنده ریسک قابل‌توجهی برای بخش تولید Upstream است. موارد مشاهده شده شامل Signal Drift و قطع موقت ارتباط، بیانگر نقص در لایه‌ی تبدیل A/D یا تخریب فیزیکی Bus Interface در برد کنترلی است که مستقیماً بر CPPهایی مانند الگوهای گلیکوزیلاسیون mAb تأثیر می‌گذارد.
change-management-records.proposedSolution:
۱. تعویض فوری ماژول‌های تخریب‌شده با واحدهای ارتقایافته دارای هیت‌سینک.
۲. پیاده‌سازی منطق نظارتی Redundant Cross-Check در PLC/DCS با استفاده از سنسور کمکی PT100/RTD.
۳. تنظیم مجدد پارامترهای PID و کالیبراسیون NIST.
change-management-records.changeClassificationJustification: به دلیل تأثیر مستقیم بر CPP (پارامتر کنترلی بحرانی) و نیاز به Re-IQ/OQ سیستم‌های کنترلی طبق استانداردهای GAMP 5 و ASTM E2500، این تغییر در رده بحرانی/عمده دسته‌بندی می‌شود.
change-management-records.qaFinalReview: بررسی نهایی باید شامل تایید صحت منطق Watchdog و تست Fail-Safe در هنگام قطع ارتباط ماژول باشد. اطمینان از کالیبراسیون همزمان هر دو سنسور برای جلوگیری از مثبت کاذب الزامی است.
